executiveSummary: Jonathan from Minnesota pitched his company 'Snow in Seconds' to the Sharks, seeking $50,000 for 10%. The product creates realistic artificial snow instantly when mixed with water. After skepticism from several Sharks about its seasonality and lack of proprietary technology, Barbara Corcoran offered $50,000 for 33%, which Jonathan accepted.
keyDecisions: Barbara Corcoran invested $50,000 for 33% equity in Snow in Seconds.

actionItems.task: Collaborate with Barbara Corcoran to expand Snow in Seconds into retail and seasonal markets.
Leverage Barbara's existing connections with holiday product distributors and retailers.

nextSteps: Jonathan will work with Barbara Corcoran to scale Snow in Seconds, aiming to increase retail presence and grow the business beyond its seasonal niche.
